I am proud to introduce legislation aimed at revitalizing our infrastructure. With the Clean Commute for Kids Act and the LIFT America Act, our communities have the tools to combat climate change and provide a safer, cleaner future for our children.

I support the #LIFTAmerica Act because I want public infrastructure that protects our health, our environment, and our children. Our nation’s infrastructure is in desperate need of repair, and this is the fix.
I introduced the Clean Commute for Kids Act today so our kids can ride school buses that run on cleaner energy sources that reduce emissions and keep our air cleaner. #ActOnClimate

The #LIFTAmerica Act makes significant investments in clean energy as we work to #ActOnClimate. Proud to support this comprehensive bill that invests in the expansion of renewable energy & energy efficiency programs that reduce carbon pollution.

I hosted an Immigration-TPS workshop on Saturday to share information about the resources available to community members with: Temporary Protected Status, Citizenship Pathway, Consulate Services & knowing your rights. My office is always available to help you w/ Federal agencies. pic.twitter.com/dtdhHH1zIa

The Department of Justice’s cruel policies regarding men, women & children fleeing violence and turning to America for help, show that we are no longer the land of the free as long as we are putting innocent asylum-seekers behind bars indefinitely.

To urge him to rescind his decision. We additionally asked the Department of Justice to provide information regarding the impact of this decision to asylum-seekers as well as the financial burden this decision will have on Americans.

His decision violates the guarantee of due process in our great country’s legal system while also wasting billions of dollars of American taxpayers’ money. That is why Congressman Darren Soto and I, along with 53 of our colleagues, wrote to Attorney General William Barr.

Once again, the Trump administration shows its contempt for those seeking safety and refuge in our country. Attorney General Barr’s recent decision in Matter of M-S- to indefinitely detain asylum-seekers is cruel and the complete opposite of what America stands for.
No victory is permanent, and we must continue fighting for equality and justice for all Americans. https://www.newsweek.com/brown-board-ed-segregation-trump-judges-1429128 …

Today, on the 65th anniversary of the landmark Brown v. Board of Ed decision, we also reflect on the immense power of the judiciary and the elected officials who appoint them. Not only to improve the lives of Americans, but to harm them as well.

As a proud cosponsor, I will vote for HR 5, the Equality Act. Our LGBTQ friends, neighbors, colleagues & family should never face discrimination simply because of who they are or who they love. It is past time to provide equal protections under the law for all LGBTQ Americans. pic.twitter.com/n50MoBTMyE

This week, I introduced H.Res. 360 to support #NationalSmallBusinessWeek & honor the vital role of small businesses & the passion of entrepreneurs in our country. As a former small business owner, I’m committed to helping small businesses and their workforce grow.

25 years ago, a 4,000 acre was considered big.  Now California combats megafires – ones larger than 100,000 acres – every year. Time to #ActOnClimate NOW.
We have the obligation to combat climate change and protect our children and their future. The time to act is now. #ActOnClimate

Californians care about their future. I stand with the Los Angelenos and Americans committed to cutting emissions and returning to the path towards a cleaner California. I support the #ClimateActionNow Act.

We have the ability to create a clean energy economy that creates jobs, cleans the air, and provides a safer climate for our children. The #ClimateActionNow Act blocks Trump from exiting the Paris Agreement and secures this future.
I cosponsored H.R.9, the #ClimateActionNow Act, because I want to secure a cleaner environment and a cleaner California for our future generations. #ActOnClimate

Today, the U.S. House of Representatives passed H.R.9, the Climate Action Now Act. Committing the United States to the Paris Climate Accord and standing by our clean energy standards will create a better future for Angelenos, Californians, and Americans.

Today, I spoke about the introduction of the National Museum of the American Latino Act which will establish the first Smithsonian Institution Museum dedicated to the history and contributions of Latinos in America. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1Cd7d_o9MK4 …

Today, we came one step closer to seeing a home for our stories on the National Mall with the introduction of the National Museum of the American Latino Act. Tell us what you would want to see in the National Museum of the American Latino in the comments! #LatinoMuseum

Together with my friends on both sides of the aisle, we are working to tell our nation’s complete history and expand on the true American narrative by telling the story of the Latino community in the United States.

There must also be a living monument that recognizes that Latinos were here well before 1776 and that in this new century, the future is increasingly Latino, more than fifty million people and growing.”

Highlighting the 2011 commission report to the President and Congress, “The Mall, more than any other public space in our country does indeed tell the story of America, and yet that story is not complete.
